teacheasy.mediahandler

Class AudioHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • teacheasy.mediahandler.AudioHandler

  • public class AudioHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles audio objects on a page, including their addition and deletion as well as maintaining their state. Audio objects are added by supplying the relevant data from the data structure. This class is used by the renderer when redrawing pages.
    Version:
    1.6 14 Apr 2015
    Author:
    Alex Cash, Calum Armstrong

      • AudioHandler

        public AudioHandler(javafx.scene.Group nGroup)
        Constructor for the audio handler.

    • Method Detail

      • createAudio

        public void createAudio(float x,
               float y,
               float width,
               java.lang.String sourceFile,
               boolean autoPlay,
               boolean loop,
               boolean visibleControls,
               boolean playButtonOnly)
        Adds an audio track to the group associated with the handler.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate for the top left of the audio player relative to the groups origin.
        y - The y-coordinate for the top left of the audio player relative to the groups origin.
        width - The width of the audio player.
        sourceFile - Absolute path to the audio file as a string. Can either be a local file path or a web address.
        autoPlay - If true, the audio player will start playing the audio track as soon as it is create.
        loop - If true, the audio track will loop back to the beginning once it has reached the end of the file. This will occur indefinitely.
        visibleControls - If true, the audio player will be displayed and can be interacted with using buttons. If false, no buttons will appear and autoPlay will be set to true.
        playButtonOnly - If true, the only button that will appear will be a play and pause button. If false, all controls will be visible.

      • playAudio

        public void playAudio(int audioId)
        Causes the selected audio object to play.
        Parameters:
        audioId - The ID of the audio object to be played.

        public void pauseAudio(int audioId)

        Parameters:

      • resize

        public void resize(int audioId,
          float nWidth)
        Causes the selected audio object to be resized.
        Parameters:
        audioId - The ID of the audio object associated with the audio player to be resized.
        nWidth - The new width for the audio player.

      • relocate

        public void relocate(int audioId,
            float x,
            float y)
        Causes the selected audio player to be relocated.
        Parameters:
        audioId - The ID of the audio track associated with the audio player to be relocated.
        x - The new x-coordinate for the audio player.
        y - The new y-coordinate for the audio player.

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(int audioId,
              boolean visible)
        Controls the visibility of a selected audio player.
        Parameters:
        audioId - The ID of the audio track associated with the audio player to have its visibility changed.
        visible - The new visibility setting, as a boolean input.

      • seekAudio

        public void seekAudio(int audioId,
             double percent)
        Causes the selected audio object to seek through the media.
        Parameters:
        audioId - The ID of the audio object to be seeked through.
        percent - The new location through the audio object, as a percentage.
